meanings.definition: to show excessive fondness or love towards someone
meanings.sent1: She dawted on her pet cat, always giving it treats and cuddles.
meanings.sent2: The grandmother dawted on her grandchildren, showering them with gifts and attention.
meanings.sent3: The puppy dawted on its favorite toy, carrying it everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The artist dawted on his masterpiece, spending hours perfecting every detail.
meanings.sent5: The child dawted on the new puppy, hugging it tightly and never wanting to let go.

meanings.sent1: The dawted puppy had a luxurious bed and a wardrobe full of outfits.
meanings.sent2: The dawted princess refused to do any chores, expecting everything to be done for her.
meanings.sent3: The dawted cat lounged on silk cushions, enjoying a life of leisure.
meanings.sent4: The dawted celebrity traveled in a private jet and stayed in exclusive resorts.
meanings.sent5: The dawted child had a room filled with toys and a personal chef to cook favorite meals.

meanings.definition: in a manner that shows excessive affection or indulgence
meanings.sent1: She spoke dawtedly to her pet rabbit, using a gentle tone and showering it with compliments.
meanings.sent2: The mother dawtedly watched her baby sleep, smiling with adoration.
meanings.sent3: The chef dawtedly prepared the dessert, adding extra sprinkles and decorations.
meanings.sent4: The actor dawtedly greeted fans, signing autographs and taking selfies with each one.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dawtedly praised her students, highlighting their achievements and efforts.
